page.title: 02FARMING AROUND BURTON PIDSEA
page.content: MANOR FARM Manor Farm is owned by Mr. T. Harrison and run by Mr. Lewis, the farm manager. The area of the farm, including the fields, is 1600 acres. In addition to the crops grown, the farm has a large number of pig units. The crops in the fields at the moment are rape, barley, wheat and beans. Once harvested, they are all stored in separate sheds. The farm stores rape seed for other farms around the village as well as its own. Crops have to be cleaned and dried before they can be stored and the farm has two machines for this purpose. The Cimbria can dry 30 tons of seed per hour, whilst the Turner can only dry 18 tons per hour. Wheat is dried at 180 degrees Fahrenheit and rape seed at 75 degrees Fahrenheit.
